content: boho free me oversized crop top by owly stitch level beginner pattern is written as small/medium/large/extra large yarn medium worsted 100g - 150m i used cotton 3/3/3 5/4 balls hook size h 5mm adjust hook size if necessary to obtain correct gauge gauge 12 stitches x 6 row in double_crochet - 10x10 cm 4inchx4inch finished measurements notes this pattern uses us terms there are 2 ways this top can be done i will explain both methods both ways work from bottom up this top is quite stretchy due to the nature of the stitches used so the measuremets are only rough guidelines the pattern is meant to be free and easy going and you can add stitches to adjust the top to your liking i will explain this more in detail later on where you can add the row or stitches the top will stretch a little bit when being worn the 4ch for at the beginning of the row or round counts as a treble_crochet the 2ch at the beginning of the row or round counts as a half_double_crochet if you are making this top stripy i will indicate when to change the colours but in order to have a nice and neat colour change i suggest to change the colour in the last st of your half_double_crochet of previous row when working method 1 or in the slip_stitch of previous round when working method 2 stitches used chain half_double_crochet treble_crochet slip_stitch abbreviations chain s chain s half_double_crochet half_double_crochet rs right side skip skip slip_stitch slip_stitch space space st s stitch es treble_crochet treble_crochet ws wrong side which way to make your top the first method make the front and back parts seperataly in row it might be easier for the complete beginner who doesn t feel comfortable working in rounds and working up the bust part with added chains the front and back panels are then sewn together on the sides and on the shoulders the second method if you make the top this way it saves you some seaming together if you are like me and strongly dislike sewing then this method is a yes for you you work in rounds for the bottom part add chains for bust and sleeves part and work in row first at the front part then at the back part when you finish you are left with a couple of stitches to seam on the shoulders both ways are pretty simple and straightforward it is a repetitive and relaxing pattern for advanced crocheter and it is simple and easy to understand for a beginner it works up quite fast as it uses a tall treble_crochet stitch method 1 front panel make 54/60/64/70 chain s row 1 rs make treble_crochet into 4th chain from your hook make treble_crochet into each of your chain turn row 2 ws if you are making a stripy top change color make 2ch make half_double_crochet into next and each of the following treble_crochet turn row 3 rs
